SEARCH
Package org.project.ClientPack

Class CliUserInterface

java.lang.Object
org.project.ClientPack.CliUserInterface
All Implemented Interfaces:
UserInterface
public class CliUserInterface extends Object implements UserInterface
Represents a command-line user interface for a client. It implements the `UserInterface` interface and provides methods for handling user input, displaying messages, and interacting with the client and server. The class uses several properties and listeners to handle various events and updates from the client and view. It also includes methods for sending different types of messages to the server based on user input.

      public CliUserInterface(ClientView clientView, ConnectionInterface client)

      clientView - reference to client view
      client - reference to client

    • serverDown

      public void serverDown()
      Handles the case when the server is unreachable. Displays an error message, waits for 10 seconds, and then exits the application.
      Specified by:
      serverDown in interface UserInterface

    • SendJoinMessage

      public void SendJoinMessage(ConnectionInterface client)
      Sends a join message to the server using the provided client connection (rmi/socket). The method prompts the user to enter a username and sends the join message with the username.
      Specified by:
      SendJoinMessage in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The client connection interface used to send the join message.

    • SendCreateGameMessage

      public void SendCreateGameMessage(ConnectionInterface client)
      Sends a create game message to the server using the provided client connection (rmi/socket). The method prompts the user to enter a username and the number of players for the game. It sends the create game message with the username and number of players. After sending the message, the nickname field is updated with the chosen username.
      Specified by:
      SendCreateGameMessage in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      client - the client connection interface used to send the create game message.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if an error occurs during the remote method invocation.

    • SendQuitMessage

      public void SendQuitMessage(ConnectionInterface client)
      Sends a quit message to the server using the provided client connection (rmi/socket). The method sends the quit message with the current nickname to indicate the player's intention to quit the game.
      Specified by:
      SendQuitMessage in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The client connection interface used to send the quit message.

    • SendPickMessage

      public void SendPickMessage(ConnectionInterface client)
      Sends a pick message to the server using the provided client connection (rmi/socket). The method sends the pick message with the current nickname, the number of tiles to pick, and the list of coordinates indicating the positions of the tiles to be picked.
      Specified by:
      SendPickMessage in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The client connection interface used to send the pick message.

    • SendTopUpMessage

      public void SendTopUpMessage(ConnectionInterface client)
      Sends a top-up message to the server using the provided client connection (rmi/socket). The method sends the top-up message with the current nickname, the flag indicating if it's the first top-up, and the index of the tile to be topped up.
      Specified by:
      SendTopUpMessage in interface UserInterface
      Parameters:
      client - The client connection interface used to send the top-up message.

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()

    • getNumTiles

      public int getNumTiles()
      Prompts the user to enter the number of tiles they want to pick. The method validates the input and ensures that it is within the valid range of 0 to 3. If an invalid input is provided, the user is prompted again until a valid input is entered.
      Returns:
      The number of tiles the user wants to pick.

    • getFirstTime

      public int getFirstTime()
      Prompts the user to enter the selected column for the top-up action.
      Returns:
      The selected column for the top-up action.

    • getCoordinates

      public List<Coordinates> getCoordinates(int numTiles)
      Prompts the user to enter the coordinates for each tile in the PickMessage.
      Parameters:
      numTiles - The number of tiles to pick.
      Returns:
      The list of coordinates for each tile.

    • getColumn

      public int getColumn()
      Prompts the user to enter the column where they want to place tiles in the TopUpMessage.
      Returns:
      The column chosen by the user.

    • getTileIndex

      public int getTileIndex()
      Prompts the user to enter the index of the tile they want to place in the TopUpMessage.
      Returns:
      The index of the tile chosen by the user.

    • getNumPlayers

      public int getNumPlayers()
      Prompts the user to enter the number of players for the CreateGameMessage.
      Returns:
      The number of players chosen by the user.
